Item ID21012

The dragon hunter crossbow is a dragonbane weapon obtained as a possible reward from the Chambers of Xeric, requiring 65 Ranged to wield. Long kebbit bolts and kebbit bolts cannot be used with this weapon, unlike the similarly named hunters' crossbow that can fire them. Broad bolts may be used if the player has their requirement of 55 Slayer. The crossbow has an attack range of 7, and the longrange combat style will increase it by 2.

The dragon hunter crossbow possesses a passive effect that increases ranged accuracy by 30% and damage by 25% when fighting draconic creatures, such as dragons and wyverns. However, Elvarg and revenant dragons are not affected by this bonus. This stacks multiplicatively with Void Knight equipment, salve amulets, and the slayer helm (i).[1]

After completion of hard Combat Achievements, the dragon hunter crossbow can be combined with kbd heads to create a black variant. Similarly, a turquoise variant can be made after the completion of elite Combat Achievements with Vorkath's head.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
13 April 2022
(update)

The dragon hunter crossbow will no longer stretch on players when wearing crystal legs.

30 June 2021
(update)

The crossbow's damage bonus has been decreased from 30% to 25%.

15 November 2018
(update | poll)

Graphically updated so that it looks less like the Dragon crossbow.

29 March 2018
(update)

Grand Exchange buy limit changed from 70 to 8, to combat price manipulation.

25 January 2018
(update | poll)

The crossbow's damage and accuracy bonuses have been increased from 10% to 30%.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 23 March 2020. (Archived from the original on 23 March 2020.) Mod Ash: "Salve effects override the Slayer helm / black mask effects (because they're either identical or bigger). So you'll get bonuses for Void, then multiplied up by the Salve effect, then multiplied up again for the dragonbane bonus."
